chapter.title: JSON Support via Jakarta EE JSON-P API
chapter.para: No, this is not the JSONP you are thinking of! JSON-P is a Jakarta EE parsing API introduced in Java EE 7. Horrible name for a new JSON parsing API! What were they thinking? Anyways, RESTEasy has a provider for it. If you are using WildFly, it is required by Jakarta EE so you will have it automatically bundled. Otherwise, use this maven dependency.
It has built in support for JsonObject, JsonArray, and JsonStructure as request or response entities. It should not conflict with Jackson if you have that in your path too.
